trans-unit.source: Sites bind a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Container> and enable communication between them, as well as provide a way for the container to manage its components.
Sites can also serve as a repository for container-specific, per-component information, such as the component name.
For more information about components, see [Programming with Components](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Gets the component associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> when implemented by a class.
A valid value for this property (that is, the value is not `null`) indicates that the component has been added to a container.
Gets the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> when implemented by a class.
`null` for the Container property indicates that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> instance does not have an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.
Determines whether the component is in design mode when implemented by a class.

The design mode indicator is stored in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>; therefore, if the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> does not have an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite> associated with it, this property is always `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the component is in design mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the component associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> when implemented by a class.
The components within a container might or might not be named.
If a component is given a name, the name must be unique among all the components within the container.

The name of the component associated with the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref>; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, if no name is assigned to the component.
